0:
- name: TZ
  value: "${TIMEZONE}"
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: "-Djgroups.dns.query=keycloak-headless"
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: edge
- name: KC_HTTP_ENABLED
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME
  value: id.${DOMAIN_1}
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT_HTTPS
  value: "true"
- name: KC_LOG_LEVEL
  value: "org.keycloak.events:DEBUG,org.infinispan:INFO,org.jgroups:INFO"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_USER}"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASS}"

# - name: QUARKUS_TRANSACTION_MANAGER_ENABLE_RECOVERY
#   value: "true"
# - name: KC_CACHE_STACK
#   value: kubernetes
# - name: KC_DB_USERNAME
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_USERNAME}"
# - name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_PASSWORD}"
# - name: KC_DB
#   value: postgres
# - name: KC_DB_URL_HOST
#   value: "postgresql.sso.svc.cluster.local"
# - name: KC_DB_URL_PORT
#   value: "5432"
# - name: KC_DB_URL_DATABASE
#   value: sso
# - name: KC_CACHE
#   value: ispn
# - name: KC_HTTP_RELATIVE_PATH
#   value: /auth
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.crt
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_KEY_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.key
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/truststore.jks
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_PASSWORD
#   value: password
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CLIENT_AUTH
#   value: request

# Could use the above envar, but lets use the quarkus conf file
quarkus.transaction-manager.enable-recovery=true
# quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/

- name: objectstore
  emptyDir:
    sizeLimit: 100Mi
- name: quarkusproperties
  secret:
    secretName: keycloak-quarkusproperties
    defaultMode: 0777

- mountPath: /ObjectStore
  name: objectstore
- name: quarkusproperties
  mountPath: /opt/keycloak/conf/quarkus.properties
  subPath: quarkus.properties

#!/bin/sh

npm install homebridge-myq
npm install homebridge-nest
npm install homebridge-platform-orbit

/hr/charts.zitadel.com-zitadel.title: zitadel helm release
/hr/charts.zitadel.com-zitadel.name: zitadel
/hr/charts.zitadel.com-zitadel.doc: Zitadel is an identity management platform which has the best of Auth0 and Keycloack combined. It's built for the serverless era.

0: mkdir -p /data/serverfiles/insurgency/cfg && cp /insserver.cfg /data/serverfiles/insurgency/cfg/insserver.cfg && cp /motd.txt /data/serverfiles/insurgency/motd.txt && chown -R 1000:1000 /data && echo "Setup complete"

#!/bin/bash
iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT
echo "true" > /iptables_setup

client
dev tun
proto udp
remote us-chicago.privacy.network 1198
resolv-retry infinite
nobind
persist-key
persist-tun
cipher aes-128-cbc
auth sha1
tls-client
remote-cert-tls server

auth-user-pass
compress
verb 1
reneg-sec 0

disable-occ

script-security 2
up /vpn/up.sh
if [ $(curl -s https://am.i.mullvad.net/ip) = '${SECRET_EXT_GATEWAY_IP}' ]; then exit 0; else exit $?; fi

/hr/grafana.github.io-helm-charts-loki-s.title: loki helm release
/hr/grafana.github.io-helm-charts-loki-s.name: loki
/hr/grafana.github.io-helm-charts-loki-s.doc: Loki is a log aggregation system that aggregates logs from various sources, such as Kubernetes, and makes them available for search and analysis. It uses a label-based approach to categorize logs, making it easy to query and retrieve relevant logs. The system is designed to be horizontally scalable, highly available, and multi-tenant, making it suitable for use in a variety of environments, including home labs.
